Carrier Pigeons: You can train pigeons to carry messages over long distances. Pigeons have been used for centuries for this purpose and are still used in some parts of the world.
Semaphore: Semaphore is a visual signaling system that uses flags or lights to communicate messages over long distances. It was widely used in the past before the invention of the telegraph.
Smoke Signals: You can use smoke signals to communicate long distance. This method was widely used by Native Americans before the invention of the telegraph.
Homing Pigeons: You can train pigeons to fly back to their home and carry messages with them. This method was widely used in the past before the invention of the telephone.
Radio: You can use a radio to communicate long distance. This method was widely used in the past before the invention of the mobile phone.
